title: Three reasons to choose sustainable fabrics
excerpt: For many style enthusiasts, a well-curated wardrobe begins with conscious choices. It is the second most important aspect of personal expression, topped only by personality itself.

children.text: For many style enthusiasts, a well-curated wardrobe begins with conscious choices. It is the second most important aspect of personal expression, topped only by personality itself. For an industry that is so vast, it is typical that there would be environmental concerns about how garments are made. Research has shown that much of the fast fashion flying around today contains synthetic microfibers and harsh dyes. Accumulation of these textiles in landfills leads to toxicity in the environment. The obvious solution is going sustainable. Organic cotton and linen are cultivated without harmful pesticides or synthetic fertilizers. If you have not switched yet, here are three reasons why you should start.
Skin Health

Chemicals used in the production of synthetic fabrics can lead to skin irritation and allergies. Various studies have shown that formaldehyde and heavy metals used in dyeing can be absorbed by the skin. By wearing organic fabrics, you limit your risk of exposure to these harsh chemicals while enjoying breathable materials that are gentle on your skin.
Protecting the environment

The use of synthetic dyes is not only harmful to humans; water bodies are also affected. When factories wash these chemicals away, the residues are deposited in rivers, posing a huge threat to aquatic life. Organic manufacturing shuns these chemicals, and you play your part in conserving the environment by choosing sustainable fashion.
Supporting the artisans

An overwhelming majority of brands that use organic materials are fair trade compliant. Buying their pieces means you are supporting the cause of fair wages. Furthermore, workers handling natural fibers are at lower risk of health issues compared to those in chemical-heavy factories. By insisting on sustainable fashion, you give the industry an incentive to make better choices.

title: Benefits of a Capsule Wardrobe
excerpt: A capsule wardrobe is curated without the clutter of fast fashion. The entire concept focuses on versatility, starting from essentials to statement pieces, all without the excess.

children.text: A Capsule Wardrobe
is curated without the clutter of fast fashion. The entire concept focuses on versatility, starting from essentials to statement pieces, all without the excess.

Most of us wear only 20% of our clothes 80% of the time. Adopting a minimalist approach minimizes the stress of dressing up and reduces textile waste. Thus, a curated collection is better for your mind and the planet.

One of the main benefits is eco-friendliness. The methods of slow fashion work to maintain quality over quantity. Another huge benefit not to be overlooked is that high-quality garments last longer. When you buy pieces certified as 100% organic cotton or wool, they provide lasting comfort.

Investing in clothes that are full of character can protect your wallet from the damage of constant replacement. The bottom line is that if you want to stay stylish and look put-together, then our collection belongs in your closet. Our fabrics are full of life because they are crafted with care.

Minimalist fashion does contain variety, just as regular fashion does, but it is in a pure form because there are no impulse buys involved. If you are looking to dress better, then it is imperative that you choose quality.

Many methods of fast fashion production involve exploitation, which is harmful to the global community. Our manufacturing processes use ethical labor, which supports communities in a natural way. If you are a conscious consumer, it will be much more beneficial to your conscience to wear clothes that are certified as ethical.

children.text: Vintage fashion offers some of the best styles in the market today. Clothing isn't just fabric, like all jeans are not the same, the same thing can be said about vintage. title: Why Slow Fashion Matters
excerpt: Everyone loves all things organic, from fresh produce to organic supermarket items but did you know that fashion is one of the most chemically drenched industries in the world?

children.text: Everyone loves all things organic, from fresh produce to organic supermarket items but did you know that fashion is one of the most chemically drenched industries in the world? This is why we only use organically grown cotton from reputable producers throughout the world. The chemicals used in growing the fiber does not only mess with our bodies and our health but impact ecosystems and the future of the industry as a whole. The reason why our Organic Collection matters is: Sustainability, It's great feel and the health factor.
Sustainability

This is a word thrown around all the time which is a good thing, but what does it really mean? According to the dictionary, Sustainability is the ”avoidance of the depletion of natural resources in order to maintain an ecological balance.” Basically, crops that use chemicals will mess up the environment, polluting waterways, habitats and poisoning the very soil that plants live in. Seems like a pretty counterproductive idea. On the other hand, organic cotton plantations ensure that the ecosystem is preserved and that plants have very little impact on their surrounding environment.
Touch and Feel!

It’s a no brainer really that organic cotton feels better. What would you rather have, chemicals in your shirt, or the natural softness of organic fibers against your skin? Natural fibers are breathable, so they regulate temperature better than synthetics. Comfy! Because organic processing is gentle, the fibers are even stronger.
Ethical Factors

And considering long term implications, let’s look at how fast fashion can impact the world. Chemicals used in production can potentially cause cancer and irritate eyes, skin and upset workers' health. When you think of how many clothes the average person buys a year, it’s a pretty substantial issue. On the other hand, Organic Fashion is bursting with benefits that have been proven to reduce environmental damage. It can also reduce the likelihood of:
Water pollution
Soil degradation
Unfair labor practices
Textile waste
Pretty impressive stuff!
